channel.title: Living in Germany
channel.copyright: This work is licensed under a Creative Commons License - Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike - http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc-sa/2.0/
channel.description: Ever wonder what it's like to live overseas? Want tips on traveling in Europe? Find out by following the adventures of two crazy Americans who packed up their five kids and moved to Dusseldorf, Germany. This Podcast was created using www.talkshoe.com
channel.itunes:author: tgwheeler
channel.itunes:subtitle: Living in Germany
channel.itunes:summary: Ever wonder what it's like to live overseas? Want tips on traveling in Europe? Find out by following the adventures of two crazy Americans who packed up their five kids and moved to Dusseldorf, Germany. This Podcast was created using www.talkshoe.com
channel.itunes:keywords: Living in Germany, Travel, Wheeler, International, American, Overseas, Expat, Children, Family, LDS, Deutsch, Foreign Country, Living Abroad, Mormon, Expatriate

item.title: #34 - Spencer & the European Soccer Championships
item.author: livingingermany@gmail.com
item.description: Spencer discusses the finer points of the European Soccer Championships. He sounds like a sportscaster to me.
item.itunes:author: tgwheeler
item.itunes:subtitle: #34 - Spencer & the European Soccer Championships
item.itunes:summary: Spencer discusses the finer points of the European Soccer Championships. He sounds like a sportscaster to me.

item.author: livingingermany@gmail.com
item.description: Shantal talks about the school wide project she just finished and what she worked on - Africa was the theme.

item.title: #32 - Shantal's Class Project
item.author: livingingermany@gmail.com
item.description: Shantal talks about how she and her classmates work together on their class projects. She was a bit tired and kept reverting back to German. I think I translated everything.
item.itunes:author: tgwheeler
item.itunes:subtitle: #32 - Shantal's Class Project

item.title: #29 - DSDS
item.author: livingingermany@gmail.com
item.description: Here is our podcast about the Finals of a DSDS, the German version of American Idol. DSDS stands for Deutschland sucht den Superstar - English: Germany seeks its Superstar.
item.itunes:author: tgwheeler
item.itunes:subtitle: #29 - DSDS
item.itunes:summary: Here is our podcast about the Finals of a DSDS, the German version of American Idol. DSDS stands for Deutschland sucht den Superstar - English: Germany seeks its Superstar.
item.itunes:keywords: Living in Germany, Travel, Wheeler, International, American, Overseas, Expat, Children, Family, LDS, Deutsch, Foreign Country, Living Abroad, Mormon, Expatriate

item.title: #28 - We Lost the Nanny
item.author: livingingermany@gmail.com
item.description: The Health Insurance did not approve the request to extend the Nanny, "Haushaltshilfe", and so Tamara is back to fending for herself. What will she do next?
item.itunes:author: tgwheeler
item.itunes:subtitle: #28 - We Lost the Nanny
item.itunes:summary: The Health Insurance did not approve the request to extend the Nanny, "Haushaltshilfe", and so Tamara is back to fending for herself. What will she do next?
item.itunes:keywords: Living in Germany, Travel, Wheeler, International, American, Overseas, Expat, Children, Family, LDS, Deutsch, Foreign Country, Living Abroad, Mormon, Expatriate

item.title: #27 - Quick Update from Spencer
item.author: livingingermany@gmail.com
item.description: Here are a couple of items from Spencer, including some German Jokes told by Spencer. And what does a 9 year old American do when he meets an 12 year old Englishman in Germany - they speak German.

item.title: #24 - A Snowy Easter with Shantal
item.author: livingingermany@gmail.com
item.description: Shantal talks about Easter, Chocolate, and Peeps, and the great surprise of having some snow on Easter and on Easter Monday (a public holiday in Germany).

item.title: #22 - Emma Discovers German
item.author: livingingermany@gmail.com
item.description: Find out how Emma, a 2 1/2 year old, deals with growing up in a bilingual home. Some words she refuses to use and others she embraces in the 2nd language. But what Emma loves most is the "mommy" language. And, who wouldn't!
item.itunes:author: tgwheeler
item.itunes:subtitle: #22 - Emma Discovers German

item.title: #15 - A Rough Week, A Really Rough Week
item.author: livingingermany@gmail.com
item.description: What does one do when their son is beaten up at school and the school doesn't even call you? We don't really know what to do either, but it sure makes for a long and rough week, trying to do something about it. And, a long episode.
item.itunes:author: tgwheeler
